title: BookMyShow under scanner over Coldplay tickets row: all you need to know
description: BookMyShow faces scrutiny from Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing over alleged irregularities in the Coldplay concert ticket sales for January 2025. CEO Ashish Hemrajani was summoned twice but failed to appear. The platform is accused of enabling black market sales and using bots to control ticket availability.
content: Entertainment ticketing platform BookMyShow received a second summons from Mumbai Policeâ€™s Economic Offences Wing (EOW) in connection with irregularities during the ticket sales for Coldplay's highly anticipated Mumbai concert, scheduled for January 2025. After skipping the first summons, Ashish Hemrajani, founder and CEO of BookMyShow's parent company Big Tree Entertainment, reportedly failed to appear for a second time. However, the company's COO, Anil Makhija, met with the officials.BookMyShow faced severe backlash from fans and allegations rose over black market ticket sales of the Coldplay concert.Here's all you need to know:Sep 22, 2024: The tickets for the Coldplay concerts, scheduled for January 18, 19, and 21, were being resold at excessive prices shortly after their official release on September 22.
